summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the remote arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell. It provides detailed instructions for public and press access via audio feed and limited in-person viewing at the courthouse, with specific provisions for alleged victims and family members.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this court order is issued, scheduling her arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the court order, providing logistical details for the remote proceedings and public access.

events.title: Maxwell's Remote Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: A video/teleconference arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Previous Court Order Issued
events.description: The court issued a previous order referenced in this document regarding courthouse access.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled a remote video/teleconference for Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing on July 14, 2020.
Public and press access to the hearing is provided via a live audio phone feed with capacity for approximately 500 callers.
Limited in-person viewing (approximately 60 seats) is available at the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse due to COVID-19 social distancing requirements.
The United States Attorney's Office is instructed to email the court with information about alleged victims who wish to be heard at the bail hearing, as entitled under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771(a)(4).
The order explicitly prohibits photographing, recording, or rebroadcasting of the proceedings, with potential sanctions for violations.
